items.summary: One of the world's leading rock art specialists accuses the WA government of burying evidence that shows current pollution levels in the state's north has left ancient petroglyphs resembling "Swiss cheese".

items.title: Virtual reality gaming 'not dead' but cutting edge technology facing challenges
items.summary: While sales decline and game studios close, Australian players and developers say VR gaming is "a stable niche" with a future full of possibilities.

items.title: Mums turning to video games to bond with kids and de-stress, study finds
items.summary: Gaming can bring numerous benefits for mums, research shows, but there is still stigma to be faced.

items.title: NT Education Minister Jo Hersey's plan to take truancy fines from Centrelink branded a 'scare tactic'
items.summary: The NT opposition has criticised a government plan to direct unpaid truancy fines to be taken out of the Centrelink payments as a campaign of "fear and punishment" against parents and says the government doesn't have the jurisdiction to do it.

items.title: How to wash your winter woollen jumpers at home according to textile experts
items.summary: Do you have a woollen jumper you've been giving a precautionary whiff before throwing back on again? Here's how to give it a wash.

items.title: Op shops give away clothes as surging donations put pressure on global fabric recycling system
items.summary: Most of us feel good when we drop off a bag of clothing at an op shop, but stores are receiving so much stock they may have to send some to landfill.

items.title: Women in the fashion industry share tips on how to be a more sustainable shopper
items.summary: Whatever your motivation, re-examining your approach buying clothes can be good for your budget and the planet. We spoke with a stylist, a sustainability advocate and a designer, to get some tips on how to maintain your personal style while being environmentally conscious.

items.title: Ways to let go of your childhood belongings
items.summary: Every item has history and memories attached, so it's hard to get rid of our childhood belongings. But these tips can help.

items.title: Boy Swallows Universe: Trent Dalton's novel goes from page to screen in star-studded Netflix adaptation
items.summary: Trent Dalton's bestselling debut novel Boy Swallows Universe cemented his place in Australia's literary landscape. Now, a seven-part Netflix series is about to bring his epic coming-of-age saga to a global audience.

items.title: Trent Dalton’s Boy Swallows Universe premieres at Queensland Theatre as part of Brisbane Festival
items.summary: As the adaptation of Trent Dalton's bestselling debut novel Boy Swallows Universe premieres in his hometown, the author celebrates how it invites people from working-class Brisbane to the theatre.

items.title: Prince Andrew withdraws from public duties, ready to cooperate with authorities over Jeffrey Epstein investigation
items.summary: Prince Andrew announces he will withdraw from public duties "for the foreseeable future" after his disastrous interview about his friendship with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

items.title: Why losing a dog can be harder than losing a relative or friend
items.summary: Many are embarrassed to publicly show too much grief over the death of a dog, but research has shown just how devastating the loss can be.

items.title: Hunter S Thompson's wife heard suicide
items.summary: Anita Thompson was talking on the phone with her husband,"Gonzo" journalist Hunter S Thompson, when she heard the trigger click in the gun the renowned US author used to kill himself.
